intro: Solidago altiplanities, commonly known as the Andean goldenrod, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in cool and dry conditions. Its yellow flowers bloom in the summer, adding a vibrant splash of color to the landscape. Solidago altiplanities plays an important role in its ecosystem by providing nectar for pollinators and habitat for small organisms.
